name: David COHEN, Councilman; Thomas Paine Cronin, President(AFSCME); Lance Haver, Education Director; James Shigaki, 12th and Somerville STS Residents Association, Appellees, v. Edward G. RENDELL, Mayor; John F. Street, President of City Council; and City of Philadelphia, Appellants

judges: Before FLAHERTY, C.J., and ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN and SAYLOR, JJ.
parties: David COHEN, Councilman; Thomas Paine Cronin, President(AFSCME); Lance Haver, Education Director; James Shigaki, 12th and Somerville STS Residents Association, Appellees, v. Edward G. RENDELL, Mayor; John F. Street, President of City Council; and City of Philadelphia, Appellants.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Samuel C. Stretton, for David Cohen, et al.
casebody.head_matter:
705 A.2d 1300
David COHEN, Councilman; Thomas Paine Cronin, President(AFSCME); Lance Haver, Education Director; James Shigaki, 12th and Somerville STS Residents Association, Appellees, v. Edward G. RENDELL, Mayor; John F. Street, President of City Council; and City of Philadelphia, Appellants.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Feb. 2, 1998.
Decided Feb. 27, 1998.
Richard Feder, Philadelphia, for appellants.
Samuel C. Stretton, for David Cohen, et al.
Before FLAHERTY, C.J., and ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN and SAYLOR, JJ.
